instructions_paragraphs: This exam consists of 10 multiple choice questions. Five are conceptual, five involve calculations. Complete all problems in the allotted time. Show all work.
Equation sheets, useful constants, and mathematical formulas are provided in the last pages of the exam handout.
mc_section_intro: There are 5 questions in this section, each is graded out of a total of 5 points.

mc_questions.label: Q1
mc_questions.stem: A copper wire and an aluminum wire with identical length and cross-sectional area are connected in series. Which statement is correct?
options: a. The current is larger in the copper wire than in the aluminum wire
b. The electric field is stronger in the copper wire than in the aluminum wire
c. The electric field is stronger in the aluminum wire than in the copper wire
d. The current density is larger in the copper wire than in the aluminum wire
e. The current density is smaller in the copper wire than in the aluminum wire

mc_questions.label: Q2
mc_questions.stem: Which of the following statements about RC circuits is correct?
options: a. The time constant of an RC circuit depends on the applied voltage
b. When a capacitor discharges through a resistor, the current decreases exponentially
c. In a charging RC circuit, the capacitor voltage increases linearly with time
d. When a battery is connected to an RC circuit, the current is initially zero
e. The energy stored in a fully charged capacitor equals the product of charge and voltage (E = QV)

mc_questions.label: Q3
mc_questions.stem: Three resistors with values R, 2R, and 3R are connected in parallel. The equivalent resistance is:

mc_questions.label: Q4
mc_questions.stem: A dielectric slab with κ = 3.0 is inserted halfway between the plates of a charged, isolated capacitor. What happens to the electric field in the region with the dielectric?

mc_questions.label: Q5
mc_questions.stem: What happens to the resistance of a copper wire if both its length and diameter are doubled?

calc_section_intro: There are 5 questions in this section, each is graded out of a total of 10 points.

calc_questions.label: Q6
calc_questions.stem: A 10.0 m copper wire of diameter 1.5 mm (ρ = 1.68 × 10⁻⁸ Ω·m at 20°C). What is the resistance?

calc_questions.label: Q7
calc_questions.stem: In the circuit shown, what is the equivalent resistance between A and B?

calc_questions.label: Q8
calc_questions.stem: A 6.0 μF capacitor charged to 120 V is connected across a 20 kΩ resistor at t = 0. What is τ?

calc_questions.label: Q9
calc_questions.stem: C₁ = 4.0 μF and C₂ = 6.0 μF in series across 12 V. C₃ = 3.0 μF in parallel with the series combo. What is C_eq?

calc_questions.label: Q10
calc_questions.stem: Battery ε = 12.0 V, internal r = 0.50 Ω, current 2.0 A. Terminal voltage?

left_equation_sections.title: Capacitance

lines: Inside linear dielectric: E = E₀/κ (for the same free charge configuration)

left_equation_sections.constants_note: Note: constants (e, ε₀) are listed in Useful constants.
